## About me!

I’m a climate scientist based in South Korea. My research interests include extreme rainfall projections and their uncertainties.

I analyze large-scale climate datasets using Python, with a strong focus on uncovering insights from geospatial data. I'm passionate about data visualization and love bringing climate stories to life through compelling maps and visual narratives. I enjoy translating complex datasets into intuitive visuals that inform and inspire.

I completed my Bachelor's degree in Statistics at Burapha University, Thailand. I then pursued a Master's degree at Kongju National University in South Korea, with the financial support of Professor Ahn Kuk-Hyun.

My research focuses on the uncertainty of climate projections related to extreme events, particularly extreme rainfall, which plays a critical role in disasters such as floods. I have recently defended my thesis, and you can view my defense slides [here](https://www.beautiful.ai/player/-OTglW3lxR6ZvrKQlIut).
